summary: Completed comprehensive testing of ARRIS Activity Feed feature for Premium users. All 16 backend tests passed. Frontend UI correctly shows upgrade prompt for Pro users and full activity feed for Premium users.
passed_tests: Backend: GET /api/arris/activity-feed requires authentication (401/403 for unauthenticated)
Backend: GET /api/arris/activity-feed returns has_premium_access=false for Pro users
Backend: GET /api/arris/activity-feed returns has_premium_access=true for Premium users
Backend: GET /api/arris/activity-feed returns live_status with queue_stats structure
Backend: GET /api/arris/my-queue-position requires authentication
Backend: GET /api/arris/my-queue-position returns 403 for Pro users (feature_gated)
Backend: GET /api/arris/my-queue-position returns 200 for Premium users with queue_items
Backend: GET /api/arris/live-stats requires authentication
Backend: GET /api/arris/live-stats returns correct structure for Pro users
Backend: GET /api/arris/live-stats returns correct structure for Premium users
Backend: GET /api/arris/recent-activity requires authentication
Backend: GET /api/arris/recent-activity returns activity list for Pro users
Backend: GET /api/arris/recent-activity returns activity list for Premium users
Backend: GET /api/arris/recent-activity respects limit parameter
Backend: Activity feed anonymizes creator data (creator_name and creator_id)
Backend: Recent activity returns anonymized data
Frontend: Pro user sees upgrade prompt in Premium Analytics tab
Frontend: Pro user does NOT see ArrisActivityFeed component (correct gating)
Frontend: Premium user sees full Premium Analytics dashboard
Frontend: Premium user sees ArrisActivityFeed component with LIVE badge
Frontend: Queue Statistics section displays correctly (Processing, Fast Queue, Standard, Completed)
Frontend: Your Queue Position section visible for Premium users
Frontend: Recent Activity section visible for Premium users
Frontend: Refresh button functional
Frontend: Auto-refresh toggle visible and checked by default
critical_code_review_comments: ArrisActivityFeedService correctly uses internal methods (_get_queue_stats_internal) to avoid deadlock when lock is already held
Feature gating properly implemented - has_advanced_analytics check for Premium access
WebSocket notification types correctly defined for ARRIS queue updates
Frontend ArrisActivityFeed component properly handles hasPremiumAccess prop for upgrade prompt
data-testid attributes present on key elements (arris-activity-feed, refresh-activity-btn)
seed_data_creation: None - used existing Pro and Premium tier creators
context_for_next_testing_agent: ARRIS Activity Feed feature fully tested. Endpoints: /api/arris/activity-feed (Premium gets full access, Pro gets limited), /api/arris/my-queue-position (Premium only - 403 for Pro), /api/arris/live-stats (all authenticated), /api/arris/recent-activity (all authenticated). Frontend ArrisActivityFeed component integrated in Premium Analytics tab of CreatorDashboard. Component shows upgrade prompt for non-Premium users and full activity feed with Queue Statistics, Your Queue Position, and Recent Activity sections for Premium users.
